text: Hello, does anyone know how I query rows in reverse order when they are manually sorted?
Hi Simon, does the manual sorting follow a certain pattern ?

Hi, not really sure what you mean.

Here is the beta that is used.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/HubDB-rearrange-order/idi-p/5167>

so use this to pull in the company id:
```{% set company = crm_associations(contact.hs_object_id, 'HubSpot_DEFINED', 1, 'name', true) %}```

`{has_more=false, offset=1, total=1, results=[{dealname=Test LLC - New Deal (Test), amount=$1, closedate=11/30/22, dealstage=1a4e48ef-e214-468c-9d51-fe5547933286, createdate=11/1/22, id=10764586870}]} ALL DEALS [{dealname=Test LLC - New Deal (Test), amount=$1, closedate=11/30/22, dealstage=1a4e48ef-e214-468c-9d51-fe5547933286, createdate=11/1/22, id=10764586870}]`

btw the output turn to be array. Is calling it to display on table is the same approach sir as:

```{% set deals = [] %}

{% do deals.extend(company_deals.results) %}

{% do deals.extend(contact_deals.results) %}```
Is it like this sir ?

`{% for deal_result in deals %}`
    `// data table item`
`{% endfor %}`
Yes you can iterate over the array using that for loop

Hey Simon!

You can use the `orderBy` query param to sort by any field on a HubDB row. For manually sorted rows, you can try doing `orderBy=-displayIndex` , which should give you your results in reverse order of the display order you defined. Feel free to reach back out if that doesn't work!
Awesome! Thanks for the quick fix!:fire:
